title: Ticket #7747: condor_submit_as_dag
description:
There remain (many?) features available in DAGMan that aren't (yet?) available via condor_submit, but it's a pain to convert from the (efficient and easy-to-use) queue in/matching/from statements to the equivalent DAG.

One (short-term?) approach to dealing with this issue is to automate the conversion process.
remarks:
2020-Jul-21 13:44:25 by tlmiller:
  • Consider rewriting condor_submit_as_dag to use the Python bindings, in particular, htcondor.Submit.itemdata(), instead of calling condor_submit.
  • condor_submit_dag will need to set ITEMINDEX, ROW, and STEP, as well.
  • It would be much better to set PROCESS and PROCID rather than try to parse the submit file well enough to replace all references thereto. Changes to PROCESS won't take without changes to HTCondor though; TJ has identified why and believes it to be a bug.

It's not clear, if we want this to become a real tool, if it should work with older versions of HTCondor; that might be nice, it might be OK if user have to manually switch references to PROCESS to PROCID on older versions. What version did htcondor.Submit.itemdata() show up in?

2020-Jul-21 13:45:12 by tlmiller:
TJ wrote: 

> if you want to do a quick and dirty test, open up submit.cpp find
void init_vars(SubmitHash & hash, int cluster_id, StringList & vars)
> and comment out this line
hash.set_live_submit_variable(SUBMIT_KEY_Process, ProcessString);

2020-Sep-28 17:18:51 by tlmiller:
Moved both open issues to subtickets to close this one for release.

2020-Sep-28 17:24:08 by tlmiller:
Not sure if we want to publicize this tool in its current form, actually.
